conbody.p: In addition to a key type and subtype, a DES control vector contains key usage values that further restrict the use of a key. Most key types define a default set of key usage restrictions in a control vector. and list the key types that have a default control vector, and show the default values of the control vector bits. DES key usage restrictions can be varied by using keywords when constructing control-vector values using the verb or the verb, or by manually setting key-usage bits in the control vector.

describes the usage keywords related to generating a control vector, building a control vector in a key token, or parsing the control vector of a key token. For information about the meaning of the bits of a DES control vector, see .

Part of the control vector of a DES key-token identifies the key type. The key type controls how a key in the key token can be used. Each DES key type falls under one of the following key classes:
Cipher (data operation)
PIN processing
Cryptographic variable encrypting key
Key encrypting key
Key generating key

lists all of the DES key types, grouped by key class, along with a reference to a figure to determine the valid rule-array keyword combinations for a particular DES key type. These keywords are used when generating a control vector ( , ), constructing a key token (, ), or parsing a key token ( , ).

table.title: , , and keyword combinations by DES key type

desc.p: CSNBCVG, CSNBKTB, and CSNBKTP keyword combinations by DES key type

conbody.p: shows the , , and keyword combinations for DES key types CIPHER, DECIPHER, and ENCIPHER. Beginning with Release 5.4 and Release 6.2, these key types support three-key Triple-DES (keywords TRIPLE and TRIPLE-O).

fig.title: , , and keyword combinations for DES CIPHER keys

image.alt: , , and keyword combinations for DES CIPHER keys

ol.li: WRAPENH2 is only valid for TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O. If TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O is specified, WRAPENH2 is the default. Otherwise, WRAP-ECB is the default.
ENH-ONLY is only valid with WRAP-ENH, WRAPENH2, or WRAPENH3. It is the default for WRAPENH3. ENH-ONLY is also the default for TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O. Otherwise there is no default.

KEYLN8 is synonymous with SINGLE. KEYLN16 and MIXED are synonymous with DOUBLE. SINGLE and KEYLN8 are not valid when COMP-TAG is specified. TRIPLE and TRIPLE-O are not valid with WRAP-ECB or WRAP-ENH. DOUBLE is the default when COMP-TAG is specified. Otherwise, the default is SINGLE.

ol.li: WRAPENH2 is only valid for TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O. If TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O is specified, WRAPENH2 is the default. Otherwise, WRAP-ECB is the default.
ENH-ONLY is only valid with WRAP-ENH, WRAPENH2, or WRAPENH3. It is the default for WRAPENH3. ENH-ONLY is also the default for TRIPLE or TRIPLE-O. Otherwise there is no default.

KEYLN8 is synonymous with SINGLE. KEYLN16 and MIXED are synonymous with DOUBLE. SINGLE and KEYLN8 are not valid when COMP-TAG is specified. TRIPLE and TRIPLE-O are not valid with WRAP-ECB or WRAP-ENH. DOUBLE is the default when COMP-TAG is specified. Otherwise, the default is SINGLE.

conbody.note: KEYLN8 is synonymous with SINGLE. KEYLN16 and MIXED are synonymous with DOUBLE. SINGLE is the default. The service only supports single length keys, so do not specify DOUBLE, DOUBLE-O, KEYLN16, or MIXED if the key is to be used by this service.

table.title: DES control vector key-subtype and key-usage keywords

desc.p: DES control vector key-subtype and key-usage keywords. A table with two columns, describing the keywords and their meaning

row.entry: IMPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the verb when the key form is OPIM.
IMPORTER and EXPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the verb when the key form is IMEX.
IMPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the verb when the key form is IMIM.
IMPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used to import a key in the verb.
EXPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the verb when the key form is OPEX.
EXPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the verb when the key form is EXEX.
EXPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used to export a key in the verb.
IMPORTER and EXPORTER keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used in the or verbs.

Key-encrypting keys that have a control vector with this attribute can be used to transport any type of key. The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued, and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.

Key-encrypting keys that have a control vector with this attribute formerly could not be used to transport key-encrypting keys. The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.

Key-encrypting keys that have a control vector with this attribute formerly could only be used to transport keys with a key type of DATA, CIPHER, ENCIPHER, DECIPHER, MAC, and MACVER. The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.

Key-encrypting keys that have a control vector with this attribute formerly could only be used to transport keys with a key type of PINVER, IPINENC, and OPINENC. The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.

Key-encrypting keys that have a control vector with this attribute formerly could only be used to exchange keys with key-encrypting keys that carry NOT-KEK, PIN, or DATA key-type ciphering restrictions. The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.
Any MAC verb can use this key.
The meaning of this keyword has been discontinued and its usage is allowed for backward compatibility reasons only.
Restricts the usage to single-length key-A key or double-length key-A and key-B keys for the and verbs.
Restricts the usage to single-length key-B key for the and verbs.
Enable the encryption of keys in an EMV secure message.
Enable the encryption of PINs in an EMV secure message.
The control vector does not require a specific PIN-calculation method.
Select the IBM 3624 PIN-calculation method with offset processing.
Select the IBM German Bank Pool PIN-calculation method.
Select the IBM German Bank Pool PIN-calculation method with institution-PIN input or output.
Select the Visa PVV PIN-calculation method.
Indicates that a PINGEN or PINVER key cannot participate in the generation or verification of a PIN when an offset process is requested.
The key can participate in the verb.
The key can participate in the verb.
The key can participate in the verb.
The key can participate in the verb.
The key can participate in the verb.
The key can participate in the verb in the Reformat mode.
The key can participate in the verb in the Translate mode.
The key can be used to multiply encrypt eight bytes of clear data with a generating key.
The key can be used to generate keys with the following key types: DATA, DATAC, DATAM, DATAMV, DMKEY, DMPIN, EXPORTER, IKEYXLAT, IMPORTER, MAC, MACVER, OKEYXLAT, and PINVER.
The key can be used to generate a single-length or double-length DATA or DATAC key.
The key can be used to generate an EXPORTER or an OKEYXLAT key.
The key can be used to generate an IMPORTER or an IKEYXLAT key.
The key can be used to generate a MAC or DATAM key.
The key can be used to generate a SECMSG with SMKEY secure messaging key for encrypting keys.
The key can be used to generate a SECMSG with SMPIN secure messaging key for encrypting PINs.
The key can be used to generate a MACVER or DATAMV key.
The key can be used to generate a PINVER key.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a key based on the key-usage bits.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL0.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL1.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL2.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL3.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL4.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL5.
A DKYGENKY key with this subtype can be used to generate a DKYGENKY key with a subtype of DKYL6.
Indicates that the key can be either a replicated single-length key or a double-length key with two different, random 8-byte values.
Specifies the key as a single-length key.
Specifies the key as a double-length key.

entry.ph: Specifies the key as a triple-length key.

row.entry: Permits the key to be exported by or . Also permits the key to be exported by the verb, unless NOT31XPT is set (CV bit 27 = B'1').
Prohibits the key from being exported by or .
Specifies the control vector is for a key part.
Prohibits the key from being wrapped with the legacy method once it has been wrapped with the enhanced method.
Permits the key to be exported by the verb.
Prohibits the key from being exported by the verb.
